definition: life (as the characteristic of living beings)/living being/creature/CL:個|个[ge4],條|条[tiao2]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

pinyin: Han2 wu3 ji4 sheng1 ming4 da4 bao4 fa1

definition: while there is life, the fight continues (idiom); to fight to the last
pinyin: sheng1 ming4 bu4 xi1 , zhan4 dou4 bu4 zhi3

definition: Ayurveda (ancient Indian system and health care philosophy)/also written 阿育吠陀[a1 yu4 fei4 tuo2]
life is motion (popular saying with many possible interpretations)/Physical effort is vital for our bodies to function (Aristotle)./Life derives from physical exercise.
pinyin: sheng1 ming4 zai4 yu2 yun4 dong4

definition: see 生命體徵|生命体征[sheng1 ming4 ti3 zheng1]
see 生命體徵|生命体征[sheng1 ming4 ti3 zheng1]

sentences.english: Her Life Line is a green ocean-plant, forest.
sentences.chinese: 她的生命線是綠色的海洋草木，森林。

sentences.english: Life creates itself in delirium and is undone in ennui.
sentences.chinese: 生命自創於狂亂，破滅於厭倦中。

sentences.english: Entirely devoted to the Party, the young soldier gave his life for his country.
sentences.chinese: 對黨無限忠誠，這位年輕的士兵爲祖國獻出了生命。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese literary theory is living, and its structure is organic.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代文論是生命性文論，是一種整體有機結構觀。

sentences.english: Brief is life, but love is long.
A key part of the program hasbeen to commercialize outstanding health science technologies from themedical colleges.
sentences.chinese: 專業的核心是將醫學院校的生命科學技術商品化。

sentences.english: Be thou faithful until death: and I will give thee the crown of life.
sentences.chinese: 你應當忠信至死，我必要賜給你生命的華冠。

sentences.english: Yet the timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness
sentences.chinese: 然而你們心中的無限，意識到生命的無限。

sentences.english: It is not cogitation; it is a waste of life.
sentences.chinese: 其實沒必要想那麼多，那只是在浪費生命。

sentences.english: This almost-falling into chaos keeps life proliferating.
sentences.chinese: 這種幾近墜落乃至混沌的運行狀態確保了生命的增殖。

sentences.english: There was a time when every moment was infused with hope and wonder.
sentences.chinese: 生命中曾有段時期充滿著希望和驚喜。

sentences.english: You will feel helpless and the transience of life and helpless?
sentences.chinese: 你還會感到生活的無助和生命的無常與無奈嗎？

sentences.english: Astrologers think of the water-bearer as pouring life-enhancing energy into the ether.
sentences.chinese: 占星學家認爲這個水瓶，是將生命的能量注入靈性。

sentences.english: This fragmentation of relationship is the degenerating factor in our life.
sentences.chinese: 關係的分割是我們生命中的墮落因素。

sentences.english: Life should be as hard and tough as a rubber ball.
sentences.chinese: 生命應如橡膠球一樣堅韌。

definition: vivid/lively/(of food ingredients) live or fresh
eternal/everlasting/fig. to pass into eternity (i.e. to die)
the world/this world/the world of the living
to live forever/eternal life/all one's life
